page.title: 19CHERRY BURTON-POTTERY 1
page.content: I fell in love with handthrown pottery many years ago on a visit to France. The rich earthy tans and browns of plates,jugs and bowls kindled an interest in pots developing through the years to the point where working with clay has become an essential part of my life.In the early years I simply collected pots from wherever we holidayed,in the winters joining evening classes to practise the skill. As my children grew up I trained as a teacher,the art course extending my interest and appreciation of pottery. In 1975 we moved to Cherry and a chance encounter with a potter gave me free time in his workshop learning more about making pots,glazing and firing.On the closure of the pottery I decided to leave teaching and become a potter.My husband created a workshop, we bought a 2nd-hand kiln and wheel.
